showerReviews.reviewText: … CON: The machines need dusting/cleaning.  I urge the managers to put in new shower heads and to fix the plumbing issues of getting hot water in the handicap shower.   There was no hot water and I wasted too much water waiting for it. …

… out at this facility at NW Loop 410.   It was a unsatisfying experience for many reasons:  1) The facility had no running water - no drink fountain, no sink, no toilet, no shower.  Proper signage alerted users to the water system being …

… end. This is one of the worst maintained gyms I have ever seen. Dumbbells and plates are all over the place. It seems no one re-racks: these pictures are from 6am. The shower heads are terrible and need to be either cleaned or replaced.

… much cleaner than the one on Bulverde, and I love their hot tub set up. No flies in the shower and the pool is crisp and cool but not freezing. Staff is friendly and attentive whereas at my home location you’re often hard pressed to FIND …

… * near closing, when she treats everyone like they're misbehaving children. She yells stuff like, "Come on guys, get out of the shower, you've got to leave!" starting 20 minutes before closing. It's the tone of voice that's disrespectful …

… the staff is very cordial. I'm always greeted at the door. Being I have no other gym to compare my experience with, I have noticed that the woman's showers are not attended to much. I do find trash in the shower stalls and the trash in the …

… just scan my card, no eye contact whatsoever. They supposedly sell large towels for showers, so i ask for one and the little boy that runs that area says," sorry bro, we dont have large towels." How am i supposed to shower now. Just a …

… when men are dressing. In other words men are undressed. They told me that they put signs in the entrance but, how about the men already in shower and getting dressed. That’s the only fitness center that I have experienced this situation.
The shower water temperature is always too hot. The staff at the front desk is professional and friendly.
Mens shower is not great. Good pressure and temp,  but the nozzles are terrible,  like a thumb over a hose.

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful campground in the heart of San Antonio. Friendly and helpful staff. Well stocked and inviting camp store. Clean and up to date bathrooms. Great swimming pool!  Hosts offer activities for the campers. Campsite was level, lots of trees and good shade, sites are well spaced. Good power and water.

We LOVED our stay at the San Antonio KOA! The weather was cold, but the friendly staff, amazing activities and warm facilities puts this KOA at the top of our list. We visited in February during a rain storm but that did not stop the fun …

This campsite is phenomenal and is so beautiful and  very beautiful and clean and well maintained. Great location downtown San Antonio is less than 10 minutes away plenty of restaurants nearby which is another great location. But in my …

This campground is more resort like than holiday like. Clean, friendly, well maintained, super staff.  Mature trees allow for many sites to be shaded. Activities galore. Family friendly and fun. Nice food options at the cafe. Best option in the San Antonio Area!

Had my daughters baby shower there. Manager was amaizing she met with me more than once to help accommodate the different families helping. Everyone  loved how everything looked and how much space we had to enjoy ourself. Will definitely be …
Went for a baby shower.  It was very nice!
